title: Logic Games are Complete for Game Logics
abstract: Introduces model construction games, connecting them to semantic tableaux and dialogical logic. Establishes a success lemma linking open branches to satisfiability.

title: Game Semantics for First-Order Logic
abstract: Formalizes FOL game semantics using HO/N-models. Emphasizes interactive interpretation of quantifiers and logical connectives.

title: Game-Theoretical Semantics for First-Order Logic
abstract: Technical note explaining game-theoretical semantics with focus on quantifier independence and strategy-based interpretations.

title: Game Semantics
abstract: Overview of game semantics, including formal foundations and applications in logic and computer science.

title: First-Order Semantic Tableau
abstract: Introduces semantic tableaux for FOL, demonstrating rules and decomposition strategies foundational to model construction games.

title: Automated Model Building
abstract: Explores heuristics and theoretical boundaries of automated model building within first-order logic.

title: Propositional and First-Order Logic Tableaux: Concept and Heuristics
abstract: Details optimization heuristics for tableaux in FOL and propositional logic, with emphasis on gamma and delta rules.

title: Automated Model Construction: A Logic-Based Approach
abstract: Connects logical model specification with solvable operations research problems, highlighting translation feasibility.

title: Logic-Based Artificial Intelligence
abstract: Stanford Encyclopedia entry covering logic-based AI principles, including default reasoning and planning frameworks.

title: Logic Tensor Networks
abstract: Presents a hybrid approach integrating deep learning with FOL reasoning, enabling differentiable logic constraint satisfaction.
